trans-unit.source: Represents a composite <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Transform"></xref> composed of other <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Transform"></xref> objects.
Use a TransformGroup when you want to apply multiple <xref:System.Windows.Media.Transform> objects to a single property.
In a composite transformation, the order of individual transformations is important.
For example, if you first rotate, then scale, then translate, you get a different result than if you first translate, then rotate, then scale.
One reason order is significant is that transformations like rotation and scaling are done with respect to the origin of the coordinate system.
Scaling an object that is centered at the origin produces a different result than scaling an object that has been moved away from the origin.
Similarly, rotating an object that is centered at the origin produces a different result than rotating an object that has been moved away from the origin.

**Freezable Features:** Because it inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> class, the TransformGroup class provides several special features: TransformGroup objects can be declared as , shared among multiple objects, made read-only to improve performance, cloned, and made thread-safe.
For more information about the different features provided by <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects, see [Freezable Objects Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TransformGroup"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TransformCollection"></xref> that defines this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TransformGroup"></xref>.
In a composite transformation, the order of individual transformations is important.
For example, if you first rotate, then scale, then translate, you get a different result than if you first translate, then rotate, then scale.
One reason order is significant is that transformations like rotation and scaling are done with respect to the origin of the coordinate system.
Scaling an object that is centered at the origin produces a different result than scaling an object that has been moved away from the origin.
Similarly, rotating an object that is centered at the origin produces a different result than rotating an object that has been moved away from the origin.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
A collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Transform"></xref> objects that define this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TransformGroup"></xref>.
The default is an empty collection.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TransformGroup.Children*> dependency property.
To be added.
Creates a modifiable copy of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TransformGroup"></xref> by making deep copies of its values.
Use this method to produce modifiable copies of read-only <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects.
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
When this method copies dependency properties, it copies resource references and data bindings although they might no longer resolve.
It does not copy animations or their current values.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable deep copy of the current object.

The <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property of the cloned object returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property of the source is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true." name="true." href=""></xref>
Creates a modifiable copy of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TransformGroup"></xref> object by making deep copies of its values.
This method does not copy resource references, data bindings, or animations, although it does copy their current values.
Use this method to produce modifiable copies of read-only <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects.
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable deep copy of the current object.

The <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property of the cloned object is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property of the source is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure that describes the transformation represented by this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TransformGroup"></xref>.
A composite of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Transform"></xref> objects in this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TransformGroup"></xref>.
